ngiemboon: Mencwò mencwò aa péʼe fóo nzɔ̌ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi? Melàʼ fóo nzɔ̌ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi? Né ńgɔɔn ngie é fóo na gi ntí letsɔ̌ɔn shúm gie ee tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí ńtsóte gẅí.
en: What is the source of wars and fights among you? Don’t they come from your passions   that wage war within you?  # 4:1 Or war in your members

ngiemboon: Pi tsɔ́ɔn shúm tɛʼ táʼ ńké te kuʼu légẅiin wɔ́, ńdeen ńké ńcʉ́ʼ ńtyé pɔ́ lézẅé nyìŋ. Pi gyá mmó, ńtÿɔ́g ntʉ́m gẅí mǒ, tá tsɔ́ légẅiin, à te wó wɔ́. Pi gebe tsetsɛ̀ɛ ńgwɔ́ mencwò mencwò, ńtág melàʼ. Pi těen ńgẅiin mmó gie pi ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́, á nue pi te lúɔ mbwó Ssé wɔ́.
en: You desire and do not have. You murder and covet and cannot obtain. You fight and wage war.   You do not have because you do not ask.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńdúɔ, e Ssé te ná, mbà áa mélàʼmie pi te zsé lélúɔ wɔ́. Pi zɔɔn ńdúɔ pɔ́ lélɔg ńgʉa ńgÿo mmó gie á ne ḿboŋo pɔ́ gẅí.
en: You ask and don’t receive because you ask with wrong motives, so that you may spend it on your pleasures.

ngiemboon: Pi ee palaŋ nzèm pʉ́a. Pi te ne ńzsé ngie nyìŋ gẅie aa shǔ shúm njÿó, cʉ̌ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngàŋmbù Ssé wɔ́ ka? Nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋ shúm njÿó cʉ̌ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngàŋmbù Ssé.
en: You adulterous people!   Don’t you know that friendship with the world is hostility toward God? So whoever wants to be the friend of the world becomes the enemy of God.  # 4:4 Jn 15:19; Jms 1:27; 1Jn 2:15

ngiemboon: Pi kwǎŋ ngie Ŋwàʼne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «E Ssé pǔ te zẅíŋ ngie pege nyé tsɔ̌ nyìŋ á jÿó jʉʼʉ Zẅìge gie à la néŋe na pege wɔ́ péʼe, ḿmeen meen ńgɔɔn keen?»
en: Or do you think it’s without reason that the Scripture says: The spirit he made to dwell in us envies intensely?  ,# 4:5 1Co 6:19; 2Co 6:16

ngiemboon: Táʼ, e Ssé ké ńne ńcÿó gʉm yégè, apòŋontʉ́m yé nzèm pege fáŋ ńcʉa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ. Aŋwàʼne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: «E Ssé lʉʼ paŋáʼte nnɛ́ lʉʼ, ńké ńdɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m, ńdíe pʉ̀a pie é sẅíʼi mbùm yɔb ńnáa ssé.»
en: But he gives greater grace. Therefore he says:

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, pi júʼ ncwò Ssé, ńdʉʼʉ Sátà, à fó lejʉ́ŋ pi ńkÿo.
en: Therefore, submit to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

ngiemboon: Pi sẅɛʼte nnɛ́ né lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, à sẅɛʼte yé nnɛ́ né lejʉ́ŋ pi. Pi megàŋ mefʉa, pi sɔg mbwó mí, pankwòŋ menÿɔ́g, pi kẅile ncÿǒ tsɛ̀ɛ mentʉ́m mí.
en: Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie pi ee megàŋngɔ́ʼ, ńdúŋ legwé ńdʉa. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie gẅi légẅe sele ńcʉ́ʼʉ lélʉa, agẅi lekág sele ńcʉ́ʼʉ lémÿɔg.
en: Be miserable and mourn and weep. Let your laughter be turned to mourning and your joy to gloom.

ngiemboon: Pi sẅíʼi mbùm gí ńnáa ssé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, à pʉʼʉ gẅí.
en: Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will exalt you.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, tà zẅɛ́te gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzẅɛ́te na fɛ̌ we, kà ńtú pɔ́ lɔ̌ʼ yé wɔ́, mbà à zẅɛ́te pɔ́ na lepʉ̌, ḿbiŋe ńtúu pɔ́ lɔ̌ʼ lepʉ̌. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ńtúu lɔʼɔ́ lepʉ̌, mbà à te gíŋe ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à kúʼte lepʉ̌ wɔ́, à cʉʼʉ́ ńtúu lɔʼɔ́ lepʉ̌ tú.
en: Don’t criticize one another, brothers and sisters. Anyone who defames or judges a fellow believer   defames and judges the law. If you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law but a judge.  # 4:11 Mt 7:1; Jms 1:22; 1Pt 2:1

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíle yé zɔ zába lepʉ̌, ḿbiŋe ńzáʼa ntsaŋ pʉ̀a, yé gíle yé zɔ kuʼu légÿo nyìŋ tsẅɛ́ kà légÿo á kwé wɔ́ɔ. Ɔ̀ kwǎŋ jú ngie ɔɔ wɔ̌ tà ńtúu lɔ̌ʼ fɛ̌ gù?
en: There is one lawgiver and judge   who is able to save and to destroy. But who are you to judge your neighbor?  # 4:12 Mt 10:28; Rm 14:4

ngiemboon: Pi zẅíʼte ńjúʼ. Pi pie pi ne ńkaʼa ngie: «Peg ge lɔg lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn kà jǔɔ wɔ́ɔ, é gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ ye kíkyè, é néŋe wó tàʼ ngùʼ, é táŋ sɔ̌ɔn, é gẅiin nkáb.»
en: Come now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will travel to such and such a city and spend a year there and do business and make a profit.”

ngiemboon: Pi te ne ńzsé páʼ lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ jǔɔ ge gwɔ́ púʼu, á mbwó pi wɔ́. Pi zsé ngie pi ee páʼ zẅɛ̌ lekʉŋ gie á kẅɛ, ńtóo lénéŋe é syeen.
en: Yet you do not know what tomorrow will bring #— #what your life will be! For you are like vapor that appears for a little while, then vanishes.

ngiemboon: Pi kɔʼɔ́ gɔɔn pɔ́ ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ, mbà peg ge gwɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, é gÿo yɔɔn, é gÿo gi.»
en: Instead, you should say, “If the Lord wills, we will live and do this or that.”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi tsẅiŋ pɔ́ kékʉ́b gẅi, ńgɔɔnte pɔ́ menò mie pi ge gÿo gÿo. Yɛ̌ ntí leŋáʼte e te poŋ.
en: But as it is, you boast in your arrogance. All such boasting is evil.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, nyìŋ gẅie à zsé légÿo nò gie áa mbòŋ, ḿbiŋ ńké te gÿo, à lɔgɔ ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, ńdɔgɔ ńgwe ntsaŋ.
en: So it is sin to know the good and yet not do it.
